entry.title: [Feature Engagement] Propagate test IPH configuration to child processes
entry.content:
There are test jobs (e.g. browser_tests_require_lacros) where the tests

are run in a browser that is external to the test executable.



In those cases, even if the test disables IPH by default (which is the

default behavior for tests), and even if it then re-enables specific

IPH, the child browser process knows none of this. This can result in

spurious help bubbles appearing in the external browser, which can

interfere with tests. We have already seen this with the ChromeVox tests.



This CL:

- Organizes all test-specific info about IPH enabling/disabling

into a single, thread-safe data structure.

- Provides a way to pass that data on to child processes during tests.

- Specifically uses this new functionality when launching an external

browser via crosapi.



These changes should have very little impact and effectively be no-ops

during normal browser operation.



The attached bug is likely related, at least in part. katie@ has

reported seeing help bubbles briefly appearing during ChromeVox tests

even in the current codebase.



Bug: b/262789941

Change-Id: I47e903118fe9cd89cdd2d687d27b04285127964a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4718652

Reviewed-by: Shakti Sahu

Commit-Queue: Dana Fried

Reviewed-by: Stefan Kuhne

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1175784}

entry.title: Fix cloning of templates with DOM Parts, and improve testing
entry.content:
This CL improves the testing of template cloning with Parts, testing

these four cases:



1. Main document parsing

2. Template (content fragment) parsing

3. Template/fragment cloning

4. Declarative Shadow DOM parsing and cloning



This CL fixes the behavior for #3 above, but leaves #4 broken. The

following changes in behavior are made:



1. Part::MoveToRoot() can be used to change the root(), including

to set it to nullptr. This happens when a Node tree is removed

from the DOM, and it contains Parts that refer to the old root.

2. IsDocumentPartRoot() is now virtual, because during a tree move,

the root() for a Part can be made nullptr even when it's a

ChildNodePart.

3. Part::disconnected_ is added to keep track of whether the

Part has been disconnected, since root() can now be nullptr.

4. (This is a bug fix) When using ChildNodePart::setNextSibling(),

the new sibling node wasn't having its Part registered with

NodeRareData, which caused a CHECK failure when trying to

subsequently clone that Part. This is caught in the new test

which clones declaratively-built templates containing Parts.



Bug: 1453291

Change-Id: Ic1c1475431cf6bd658f191db78003204412ef78f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4713668

Reviewed-by: David Baron

entry.title: Return early after WebGPU metrics collection
entry.content:
Metrics collection only needs to discover a few adapters on the system,

instead of all of the adapters displayed in about://gpu.

This CL makes it so we return early after metrics collection and avoid

finding more adapters.



Discovering all adapters may run into GPU watchdog hangs on some devices.

entry.title: arc-a11y: Clear AXTreeSourceAndroid::Hook when root window changes
entry.content:
We have AXTreeSourceAndroid::Hook to keep some state across events.

The hook instance is attached to a node ID, but it's possible that the

same node ID is reused when the root window id has been changed. We

should clear the list of hooks when it happens, otherwise we may

accidentally keep stale states.



This fixes DCHECK failure in AutoCompleteHandler::PostSerializeNode.

entry.title: Revert "Remove redundant existence check in PathService"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 5ed59357a82db71fc98993f96dd5111411529e36.



Reason for revert: Tests are failing because a folder fetched by PathService::Get call seems to be missing when setting up a the javascript browser tests.

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac11%20Tests/19934/overview

This was the only CL that seemed relevant. Unable to test locally and will try reverting.



Original change's description:

> Remove redundant existence check in PathService

>

> Callers of PathService::OverrideAndCreateIfNeeded may ask it to ensure

> that the given path exists as a directory. Chrome's

> InitializeUserDataDir uses this to set the path for

> chrome::DIR_USER_DATA on the basis of command line or enterprise policy

> options. Since base::CreateDirectory itself will return true if the

> given path already exists as a directory, and will return false if the

> given path either names a file or such a directory cannot be created,

> there is no need for OverrideAndCreateIfNeeded to make any checks on the

> path before calling CreateDirectory. Doing so is only wasted I/O and can

> lead to filesystem races.

>

> Bug: 1336338

> Change-Id: If0b910f90ce5d89af56731edd6fb7d0787124a6d

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4685555

> Reviewed-by: Francois Pierre Doray

> Commit-Queue: Francois Pierre Doray

> Auto-Submit: Greg Thompson

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1175536}



Bug: 1336338

Change-Id: I2fae1af4ad492d2eca552cdfd3577b125bc3b3a1

entry.title: Reland "graphite: Enable DXGI shared handle in D3D11VideoDecoder"
entry.content:
This reverts commit b3b3315d980fde674984382bb13a6c04efc684cb.



Reason for revert: The CL was mistakenly reverted for ChromeOS test failures without root causing the failure.



Original change's description:

> Revert "graphite: Enable DXGI shared handle in D3D11VideoDecoder"

>

> This reverts commit ac6e0466b5903dc6e6f9633c88b5510fb2c6372a.

>

> Reason for revert: Seems cause the multi CI failures

>

> Original change's description:

> > graphite: Enable DXGI shared handle in D3D11VideoDecoder

> >

> > Enable the use of DXGI shared handles in D3D11VideoDecoder when running

> > Graphite or if the D3D11VideoDecoderUseSharedHandle feature is enabled,

> > both of which are experimental.

> >

> > Also disable texture arrays when using shared handles since Dawn doesn't

> > support importing those as external images. This is more useful than the

> > current behavior where shared handles are used, but the video frame is

> > not Dawn/WebGPU compatible if a texture array ends up being used.

> >

entry.title: [lacros] Fix GetPrimaryUserProfile crash on signin
entry.content:
This change fixes a crash that happens when Ash is restarted

before the session is initialized (e.g. when applying some flags).



Normally, Lacros would not be running at that point, but when

prelaunching at login screen, it is, which causes the termination

handler to try and update the LoginPref, when the profile is

not yet available.



This CL adds an additional check that only updates the LoginPref

if the primary user's profile is available.



TEST=Triggered Ash restart with prelaunch flag enabled

BUG=1439970



Change-Id: If5be0a972915b44cbc93ad3d6ae977b513469c1d

entry.title: Replace SkiaGoldPixelDiff ctor with a getter that reuses sessions
entry.content:
This CL replaces explicit constructing of SkiaGoldPixelDiff with an API

get or create and initialize existing sessions. This is useful because

the initialization of SkiaGoldPixelDiff is expensive and modifying test

suites to initialize sessions once per suite is cumbersome.



Some behavioral changes:

- No longer possible to have an uninitialized SkiaGoldPixelDiff since

they cannot be directly instantiated.

- SkiaGoldPixelDiff now takes the full golden image name. Callers need

to keep track of the prefix and suffix.

- SkiaGoldPixelDiff is now final, so any test helpers that extended it

now own an pointer to a session.

- The default corpus and test environment is considered part of the

session key, even though it is implicitly added.

- No longer passes --dryrun to the auth call.

- No longer initialize DCompPresenterSkiaGoldPixelDiff during test suite

setup, it's now on the first pixel diff test.



Change-Id: I7fa52d5943b14fcd9a557a5785e5e4cee924c162

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4682800

Commit-Queue: Michael Tang

Reviewed-by: Rafael Cintron

Reviewed-by: Brian Sheedy

Reviewed-by: Scott Violet

entry.title: Enhance the "mixed 32-/64-bit devices" filter for BitnessForMidRangeRAM
entry.content:
The cpu_abi_bitness_support filter works only when the bundle was

installed by Play. But it's also possible for a user to sideload a

different bundle.



An even better way to got about it would be filter out all bundles not

installed by Play (even if for a mixed device), but the method to do

this isn't fully reliable.



Bug: 1462131

entry.title: Revert "[GM3] Moving Panorama color picker to cr_component"
entry.content:
This reverts commit ef6b6c661fbab76d92eb4720b02f1c6e4f0dbcb2.



Reason for revert:

LUCI Bisection identified this CL as the culprit of a build failure. See the analysis: https://luci-bisection.appspot.com/analysis/b/8774471006948593921



Sample failed build: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8774471006948593921



If this is a false positive, please report it at https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/entry?comment=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fluci-bisection.appspot.com%2Fanalysis%2Fb%2F8774471006948593921&components=Tools%3ETest%3EFindit&labels=LUCI-Bisection-Wrong%2CPri-3%2CType-Bug&status=Available&summary=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F4676662



Original change's description:

> [GM3] Moving Panorama color picker to cr_component

>

> The start of the html and css was copied over in

> https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4652259.

> This is largely a moving over (with a little copying) of code to make

> the theme color selector from the Customize Chrome side panel reusable

> in Settings. There is also cleanup so that CustomizeChromePageHandler

> doesn't have unused methods and mojom data after the removal. Notable

> changes or things I felt might need explaining in the cleanup have a

> comment on them to help make this easier to navigate.

>

> In this CL:

> * Anything needed from CustomizeChromePageHandler and the associated

entry.title: Discard transient framebuffer attachments only upon composite.
entry.content:
WebGL's DrawingBuffer was incorrectly discarding transient framebuffer

attachments (the depth and stencil buffers for the default framebuffer

with preserveDrawingBuffer:false) when resolving a multisampled

default framebuffer on behalf of public entry points. This was exposed

by the fix for Issue angleproject:8228 through failures of the

conformance/context/context-attributes-alpha-depth-stencil-antialias.html

test, and explains other preexisting failures of this test.



Refactor the internal resolution methods to distinguish between

resolves for the compositor, and for public APIs.



Fixed: 1467393

entry.title: cellular: Fix FeatureUsageMetrics for eSIM
entry.content:
This change fixes the FeatureUsageMetrics for eSIM so that both the

IsEligible() and IsEnabled() implementations use the same source of

truth for determining their return. Previously the IsEnabled() method

relied on device prefs that cached the eSIM state while IsEligible

directly checked whether an EUICC was available; this breaks down in the

situation where the EUICC might not be available, e.g. Hermes is down,

but we still have cached eSIM profiles.



Bug: b/291812699

Test: Manually verified on a Linux build.

entry.title: Revert "[FedCM] Use CCT for showModalDialog() part 2"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 0a9da4878ebe71aa3521634715ede94e1ac3ed3d.



Reason for revert: failing on arm64 bots



Original change's description:

> [FedCM] Use CCT for showModalDialog() part 2

>

> This CL finalizes Android support for the IDP sign-in via a CCT. The

> flow is a bit different from desktop:

> 1. showModalDialog() is invoked on the opener, which launches a CCT.

> This also adds an ActivityStateObserver to detect when the CCT has

> been closed. We also notify the AccountSelectionMediator to ensure

> that it does not attempt to show the bubble while the CCT is open.

> 2. closeModalDialog() is invoked on the CCT directly, so that we may

> query the delegate using the static mapping and the FedCM ID of the

> intent. We call onModalDialogClosed() on the opener, which notifies

> the mediator and cancels the activity observer. When the opener

> becomes interactable again, we will show the FedCM UI.

> 3. If the CCT is instead closed some other way, the opener is notified

> via onActivityResumed(), so that it may invoke onDismissed() to send

> the termination of the flow to the JavaScript API.

>

> To make this change work:

> * We now receive the WebContents in the creator of

> IdentityRequestDialogController instead of the individual methods, as

> we want it on CloseModalDialog() in the Android case.

> * We no longer attempt to destroy and recreate the Java Bridge when a

> show method is invoked. This is so that the object which receives the

> second show (once the IDP signin occurs and the second accounts fetch

> happens) is the same as the first one, and the flow works as intended.

>

> Bug: 1456368

> Change-Id: I62d19661560154b818e6c8f733955f291f7eb0de

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4708206

> Reviewed-by: Christian Biesinger

> Reviewed-by: John Abd-El-Malek

> Reviewed-by: Theresa Sullivan

> Commit-Queue: Nicolás Peña

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1175483}



Bug: 1456368, 1467957

entry.title: Fix crash in PreloadingAttemptImpl::SetFailureReason.
entry.content:
The check in PreloadingAttemptImpl::SetFailureReason that

failure_reason_ is PreloadingFailureReason::kUnspecified was failing,

meaning that the failure reason was already set. The only way for this

occur is for a PrefetchContainer to have its status set to

PrefetchStatus::kPrefetchNotUsedCookiesChanged multiple times.



This CL fixes this issue by resetting the streaming URL loaders after

setting the status of a PrefetchContainer to

PrefetchStatus::kPrefetchNotUsedCookiesChanged, therefore marking it as

not servable.

entry.title: Fix rSAFor WPT dual-write test case
entry.content:
The purpose of this test is to verify that a successful

requestStorageAccessFor() call also sets a storage-access grant so

that requestStorageAccess() should be resolved without a user gesture.

However the test was testing this behavior in a same-origin iframe,

in which case requestStorageAccess() is resolved not due to the

existing grant.

entry.title: [CrossDevice] Remove unclear aria-describedby attribute in settings
entry.content:
The multideviceSubLabel element specified in the Set up/Verify button's

aria-describedby attribute contains a "Learn more" link to a help

article. This should not be read aloud to cvox users when hovering over

the button and does not add descriptive value to the button. These

buttons already have descriptive aria labels so we can remove the

unclear aria-describedby attribute.



Behavior before: When focusing on Set Up button, cvox read "Set up your

phone. Learn more"

Behavior after: When focusing on Set Up button, cvox reads "Set up your

phone."



Test: manually tested with atlas and pixel4a. existing tests pass

threshold, we will disable expand/collapse on all the popups.

the logic clearer with the new functions. Notification's header row is

also made unfocusable (as it should) to avoid failing the accessibility

paint check.

entry.title: [bhi] Raise the pending time threshold to reduce noise; remove p95/p99
entry.content:
At the moment, many of our pilot builders are bouncing back and forth

between healthy and unhealthy because their healthy state pending time is

around 10 minutes. 20 minutes will make for a better default threshold.



Also to simplify the setting of these thresholds for us and future users, I'm removing the p95/p99 thresholds. They can still be added builder-by-builder, but for now, we should encourage a simpler config.

entry.title: Create paper with variable height
entry.content:
Presently media-col-database entries with variable width or height are

ignored. For roll printing, these heights are needed. One part of this change will include these variable size entries. The other part of this change will filter the variable entries as so:



Only variable heights are supported, so if an entry has variable height and width, that entry will get ignored, but for every other entry that has a fixed width, a new entry will get added with that fixed width and the variable height. Basically this means if a receipt printer has two different widths it supports, there will be two entries added - one for each width and a variable height.

> Revert "[3pp] Implement 3pp for chromium/build/fuchsia/"

> > [3pp] Implement 3pp for chromium/build/fuchsia/

> >

> > It uploads the content into the chromium/fuchsia/test-scripts cipd

> > package, so it can be used to share with other repos.

> >

> > Unlike other implementations, `latest` returns the sha256 of the files

> > in the archive so that it can ignore most of the chromium changes but

> > focus only on the changes in the desired folder.

> >

> > A TODO is to remove the irrelevant files from the cipd package, but it

> >

> > The 3pp should be automatically picked up by

> >

> > FYI: 3pp is a system to upload packages to the cipd, since manual

entry.title: [autosharder] Dedupe swarming tasks
entry.content:
There are duplicate tasks in the swarming table causing the query to

think there are more shards than there actually are. Dedupe them to get

more accurate counts and avoid attempting to reshard suites with 1

shard.



The task_results_summary_flat does not work with a grouping since its

a view which causes a resource limit error (I believe because it

can't figure the partition out and grabs the whole thing) so that is

also being changed to task_results_summary



Quantiles are also being adjusted to be more accurate while we're

editing the query

entry.title: [Chrome Labs] Move Chrome Labs off Finch
entry.content:
This CL implements Chrome Labs for 99% of pre stable channels without

the use of Finch. This solution was discussed with the Finch team. We

keep the base::Feature in to allow for manually turning on and off

Chrome Labs through chrome://flags.



ScopedChannelOverride is needed to ensure that the Chrome Labs feature

is enabled during tests for branded builds which may use Stable as the

channel (We do not enable Chrome Labs on Stable). However,

ScopedChannelOverride is not supported on ash, so we only run Chrome

Labs tests for non branded builds on ash. Chrome Labs will not be on ash

chrome after Lacros ships.

entry.title: Do not show Eye Dropper if the owner frame is not active.
entry.content:
Currently, while the Eye Dropper is dismissed when a window focus change happens, it can still be opened if the parent frame is not focused on the time of invocation. This gives opening to a scenario in which a different Chrome window is focused but no cursor is shown on the screen as the Eye Dropper grid is being rendered behind the focused window. Attackers could use this opportunity to trick the user into clicking different parts of the screen, such as having the user grant unwanted permissions. This change fixes this issue by ensuring that the frame view is focused when the Eye Dropper is shown.



Bug: 1462723

Change-Id: I5f7ca420f2cedd07ce03b70966b64ad200bd32df

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4720045

entry.title: geolocation: Check system permission state in FillDiagnostics
entry.content:
Preserve the started state (kHighAccuracy or kLowAccuracy) in the

provider's internal `state_` instead of overwriting it with

kBlockedBySystemPermission. This allows the state to revert to the

intended state once the permission is granted.



This fixes a bug on macOS where the internals page would always show

"Blocked By System Permission" for the provider state, even after the

permission was granted.

entry.content:
This CL follows the approach from this CL: https://crrev.com/c/4370903

to load internal assets.



See go/luci-cipd for information about what CIPD is.



The CIPD_README.md file in this CL explains the process for updating the

CIPD package.



Sorry about the diff noise in shimless_rma.cc -- adding the line

`#if BUILDFLAG(GOOGLE_CHROME_BRANDING)` on line 283 triggered a

formatting change. Essentially, what we're doing here is enabling

a certain set of strings if we're on the internal / Google-branded

entry.title: cros_next: fix floating button background
entry.content:
Since PillButton's elements are able to use color ID, we no longer

need to initialize the button after adding to a widget. We moved

PillButton::Init in ctor in crrev.com/c/4643088.



However, some buttons, for example the button on system nudge, are

built with view builder which uses default type on creation, but may

need to set to other types. When it is set to floating type button,

the default background still remains. For example:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/4Mzok9C2kM68z4D



This cl fixed the issue by removing the background for floating type

button in PillButton::Init. After fixing, we get a correct floating

type button: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/5CJGp8dtHmKt5Z2

entry.title: [infra] Configure the shadow reclient instance for CI builders.
entry.content:
In order to avoid untested recipe code from modifying machines used for

CI builds, which we assign a higher level of trust to, we want to

trigger led builds in thr try pool, which necessitates using a try

service account which in turn requires using a reclient instance that

the try service account can access.



This change adds the shadow_reclient_instance argument to builders. If

set (either explicitly or by the module-level default) and the builder

creates an reclient property, then the shadow properties for the builder

will be set so that shadow builds have the $build/reclient property

replaced with one that changes the instance used to the shadow reclient

instance.



Bug: 1464986

entry.title: Don't respond to pending checks on shutdown
entry.content:
On browser shutdown, there's no value in completing these checks.

Depending on timing, it can lead to CHECK failures by trying to complete

new navigations. So this CL makes the database manager drop those

requests. It also cleans up a DCHECK failure that would occur if we

allowed the requests to CancelCheck after shutdown.

entry.title: ui/display: Add a FinalTaskStatus Metric for display configurations
entry.content:
This CL adds a metric to track the final status of a display

configuration attempt. The three possible outcomes are:

1) Failure

2) Success

3) Partial success, which means a configuration was successful but not

at the requested resolution or refresh rate of one or more of the

displays.



This Metric will help inform us as we work towards a solution to the

long standing known issue in which the display settings UI goes out of

sync with the actual resolution a display may be configured to due to

Chrome's configuration fall-back logic.



Also, this CL removes some obsolete histograms from gpu/histograms.xml.



Bug: b:207088159

Test: chrome://histograms/#ConfigureDisplays.Modeset.FinalTaskStatus

entry.title: [DTC] Make SigningKeyPair Ref Counted
entry.content:
In the current implementation, the Device Trust SigningKeyPair instance

was held in a unique_ptr inside the DeviceTrustKeyManager, which is a

browser-level object. However, in the shutdown sequence, it gets deleted

before the ThreadPool. This means that there is a (very slim)

possibility that any task running on the ThreadPool making use of that

key could run into a UAF problem.



Since the key is expensive to load or copy, the best way forward it to

convert this unique_ptr to a thread-safe ref-counted scoped_refptr.



Fixed: 1458303,b:293289710

Change-Id: I035f9447c6380e988fc4f796fe27740f604d997e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4722086

entry.title: [ios] Add Prefs to track new Most Visited Sites in top four
entry.content:
kIosLatestMostVisitedSites saved the latest fetched Most Visited Sites

so that the client can detect new sites in the top four.



kIosMagicStackSegmentationMVTImpressionsSinceFreshness will keep track

of the number of impressions since the last change to the top four

Most Visited Sites so that it can be sent to the Segmentation Platform

for ranking.



IOSMostVisitedTopSitesChanged user action is also logged when there is

a new top four site as a way for the Segmentation team to investigate

a future where all of this can be handled by aggregating metrics.



Bug: 1462664
